Title: Analysis of transfer pricing cases in relation to royalty expense in indonesian tax court: A framework for court excellence approach
Affiliations: Accounting Department Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Jamilah, Accounting Department Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Soepriyanto, G., Accounting Department Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Meiryani, Accounting Department Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to analyze the fairness of Indonesian Tax Court verdicts which was measured by Modified Singaporean Justice Scorecard according to existing transfer pricing regulation in Indonesia. Using all verdicts published in Indonesian tax court website; we find that the court decisions have been considered as fair with a low percentage of incompliance. The findings are important for taxpayers, regulator and policymakers, as they signal the effectiveness of tax court process. © 2020 Innovare Academics Sciences Pvt. Ltd. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Royalty; Tax Court; Tax Court Fairness; Transfer Pricing
